grade1-basic-arithmetic-operations.name: Basic Arithmetic Operations (0-20)
grade1-basic-arithmetic-operations.description: Master addition and subtraction within 20, including number bonds, crossing ten, and mental calculation strategies

grade1-geometry-and-spatial-awareness.name: Geometry and Spatial Awareness
grade1-geometry-and-spatial-awareness.description: Recognizing shapes, understanding spatial relations, and exploring symmetry through hands-on activities

grade1-introduction-to-measurement.name: Introduction to Measurement
grade1-introduction-to-measurement.description: Comparing and measuring lengths, telling time, understanding money values, and basic time concepts

grade1-data-and-probability-basics.name: Data and Probability Basics
grade1-data-and-probability-basics.description: Collecting data from the immediate environment, creating tally charts and simple tables, understanding probability language

grade1-number-concept-development.name: Number Concept Development
grade1-number-concept-development.description: Understanding numbers 1-20, counting forwards and backwards, comparing and ordering numbers

grade1-patterns-and-structures.name: Patterns and Structures
grade1-patterns-and-structures.description: Identifying, continuing, and creating patterns with shapes, colors, and numbers

grade2-geometry-and-symmetry.name: Geometry and Symmetry
grade2-geometry-and-symmetry.description: Exploring geometric solid properties and creating symmetrical figures with mirror lines

grade2-introduction-to-multiplication-an.name: Introduction to Multiplication and Division
grade2-introduction-to-multiplication-an.description: Understanding multiplication as repeated addition and division as sharing and grouping, with times tables for 2, 5, and 10

grade2-measurement-skills.name: Measurement Skills
grade2-measurement-skills.description: Working with lengths, time, and money - measuring, converting, and calculating with standard units

grade2-numbers-and-operations-to-100.name: Numbers and Operations to 100
grade2-numbers-and-operations-to-100.description: Understanding place value, addition, subtraction, comparing, ordering, and rounding numbers within the range 0-100

grade2-patterns-and-data-representation.name: Patterns and Data Representation
grade2-patterns-and-data-representation.description: Recognize number patterns, create charts, and compare event probabilities

grade3-all-measurement-domains.name: All Measurement Domains
grade3-all-measurement-domains.description: Working with lengths, mass, volume, time, converting units, and solving complex measurement problems

grade3-arithmetic-laws-and-patterns.name: Arithmetic Laws and Patterns
grade3-arithmetic-laws-and-patterns.description: Understanding and applying commutative, associative, and distributive properties; recognizing and creating number sequences

grade3-data-probability-and-combinatoric.name: Data, Probability and Combinatorics
grade3-data-probability-and-combinatoric.description: Collect data, create diagrams, investigate probability through experiments, and find all combinations systematically

grade3-geometry-and-area.name: Geometry and Area
grade3-geometry-and-area.description: Properties of geometric figures, symmetry, drawing with tools, and measuring area with square units

grade3-multiplication-and-division-maste.name: Multiplication and Division Mastery
grade3-multiplication-and-division-maste.description: Automatic recall of multiplication facts, division with remainders, and multi-digit multiplication strategies

grade3-numbers-and-operations-to-1000.name: Numbers and Operations to 1000
grade3-numbers-and-operations-to-1000.description: Place value, comparing, ordering, rounding, mental addition and subtraction strategies with three-digit numbers

grade3-written-addition-and-subtraction.name: Written Addition and Subtraction
grade3-written-addition-and-subtraction.description: Standard algorithms for multi-digit addition and subtraction with regrouping

grade4-advanced-geometry.name: Advanced Geometry
grade4-advanced-geometry.description: Geometric constructions, transformations, solids and nets, area and perimeter calculations using tools

grade4-algebraic-thinking.name: Algebraic Thinking
grade4-algebraic-thinking.description: Understanding terms, order of operations, simple equations, variables, divisibility, and functional relationships

grade4-data-analysis-and-statistics.name: Data Analysis and Statistics
grade4-data-analysis-and-statistics.description: Analyzing diagrams, calculating arithmetic mean, comparing datasets, and understanding probability concepts

grade4-fractions.name: Fractions
grade4-fractions.description: Understanding fractions as parts of a whole, fraction notation, and comparing simple fractions

grade4-large-numbers.name: Large Numbers
grade4-large-numbers.description: Understanding numbers up to one million, place value, rounding, and number comparison

grade4-written-multiplication-and-divisi.name: Written Multiplication and Division
grade4-written-multiplication-and-divisi.description: Standard algorithms for multiplying and dividing multi-digit numbers with estimation and remainder interpretation

data-collection-charts.name: Data Collection and Charts
data-collection-charts.description: Collecting, organizing, and representing data using tables, bar charts, pictographs, and line graphs

divisibility-prime-numbers.name: Divisibility and Prime Numbers
divisibility-prime-numbers.description: Understanding divisibility rules, distinguishing prime and composite numbers, and working with factors

volume-capacity.name: Volume and Capacity
volume-capacity.description: Introduction to three-dimensional measurement, calculating volume of cuboids, converting between volume and capacity units, solving practical problems

angle-relationships.name: Angle Relationships
angle-relationships.description: Understanding angle types, complementary and supplementary angles, vertical angles, and angle relationships formed by parallel lines and transversals

area-perimeter.name: Area and Perimeter
area-perimeter.description: Calculating perimeter and area of rectangles and squares, understanding units, converting between area units, solving practical problems

geometric-shapes-2d.name: Two-Dimensional Geometric Shapes
geometric-shapes-2d.description: Properties and classification of basic 2D shapes including triangles, quadrilaterals, and circles, symmetry and geometric constructions

measurement-units.name: Quantities and Units of Measurement
measurement-units.description: Working with standard measurement units for length, mass, time, and money including conversions and practical applications

natural-numbers-operations.name: Natural Numbers and Basic Operations
natural-numbers-operations.description: Introduction to the natural number system, place value understanding up to millions, and mastery of the four basic arithmetic operations with increasingly large numbers

fraction-operations.name: Fraction Operations
fraction-operations.description: Comprehensive fraction work including expanding, reducing, converting, and performing all four operations with fractions

integers-negative-numbers.name: Integers and Negative Numbers
integers-negative-numbers.description: Extending the number system to include negative integers, understanding absolute value, and performing operations with positive and negative numbers

rational-numbers.name: Rational Numbers
rational-numbers.description: Understanding the rational number system (ℚ), operations with positive and negative fractions and decimals, flexible conversions, and solving complex problems

probability-basics.name: Introduction to Probability
probability-basics.description: Understanding probability as a measure of likelihood, exploring experimental vs theoretical probability, and calculating simple probabilities

area-complex-shapes.name: Area of Composite Shapes
area-complex-shapes.description: Calculating areas of triangles, parallelograms, trapezoids, and composite figures through decomposition and formula application, solving multi-step problems and verifying calculations

circle-geometry.name: Circle Geometry
circle-geometry.description: Circle terminology, circumference calculation (C=πd), area calculation (A=πr²), and solving real-world problems involving circles

congruence-similarity-intro.name: Congruence and Similarity Introduction
congruence-similarity-intro.description: Explore triangle congruence conditions (SSS, SAS, ASA, AAS), similarity concepts, scale factors, and their applications to maps and scale drawings

triangles-quadrilaterals.name: Triangles and Quadrilaterals
triangles-quadrilaterals.description: In-depth study of triangle and quadrilateral properties, classification by angles and sides, angle sum theorems, congruence, and geometric construction techniques

surface-area-volume.name: Surface Area and Volume of Solids
surface-area-volume.description: Comprehensive understanding of surface area and volume of three-dimensional solids including prisms and cylinders, calculating using formulas, working with nets, and solving real-world problems

linear-equations.name: Linear Equations
linear-equations.description: Solving linear equations with one variable including one-step, two-step, variables on both sides, and real-world word problems

inequalities.name: Linear Inequalities
inequalities.description: Understanding inequality notation, solving simple inequalities, representing solutions on number lines, and working with solution sets

terms-algebraic-expressions.name: Terms and Algebraic Expressions
terms-algebraic-expressions.description: Understanding variables, writing and interpreting algebraic expressions, simplifying terms using the distributive property, and evaluating expressions with given values

statistics-interpretation.name: Statistics Interpretation and Analysis
statistics-interpretation.description: Understanding measures of central tendency, data analysis, and statistical reasoning with real-world applications

coordinate-system-advanced.name: Coordinate System and Linear Functions
coordinate-system-advanced.description: Mastering the coordinate system with all four quadrants, graphing linear relationships, understanding slope and y-intercept, creating graphs from real-world situations, and calculating distances

proportional-relationships.name: Proportional and Inversely Proportional Relationships
proportional-relationships.description: Understanding direct proportionality (y=kx) and inverse proportionality (y=k/x), determining the constant of proportionality, applying the rule of three, creating and interpreting proportional graphs
